Followed by a postscript in June 1961; see below.<lb/>Under the title on the front wrapper of a copy of the offprint (in my collection),<lb/>Carter wrote “largely misdescribed.” For Carter’s earlier notes on the subject,<lb/>see D:1958 ( June and Autumn).<lb/>A “Farewell, Catullus,” Texas Quarterly 3.3 (Autumn 1960): 274-84. On his collecting<lb/>of Catullus. The collection, which went to Texas, is described (not by Carter)<lb/>in Goldschmidt catalogue 116, lot 69, pp. 20-24, priced at £1225. In<lb/>the Eton copy, Carter notes that the collection had earlier been offered to<lb/>King’s College for £250 and declined.<lb/>R [Review of volume 4 of W. W.
